page.title: 18DEWARTOWN
page.content: DEWARTOWN IS A SMALL COUNTRY VILLAGE 4 KILOMETRES SOUTH OF PATHHEAD VILLAGE. THE VILLAGE IS ISOLATED INASMUCH AS NO PUBLIC TRANSPORT SERVES THE PEOPLE OF DEWARTOWN. THE VILLAGE ITSELF RUNS IN AN EAST-WEST DIRECTION AND CONSISTS OF 27 HOUSES AND HAS A POPULATION OF APPROXIMATELY 50. THERE ARE NO SHOPS IN THE VILLAGE AND THE RESIDENTS HAVE TO TRAVEL TO DALKEITH OR EDINBURGH TO SHOP. THE PEOPLE IN THE VILLAGE ARE MOSTLY RETIRED OR SEMI-RETIRED AND THE WORKING POPULATION TRAVEL TO NEARBY TOWNS TO PURSUE THEIR OCCUPATIONS. THE HOUSES IN THE VILLAGE ARE VERY OLD. THE MOST MODERN HOUSE DATING BACK TO 1907 AND THE OLDEST, TYNE COTTAGE, 1783. IN THE YEAR 1901 THE POPULATION OF DEWARTON, WHICH CONSISTED MOSTLY OF FARM WORKERS, WAS 80.
